title: World History - Intermediate
description: Intermediate world history covering major periods and developments

questions.question: Which treaty ended World War I?
questions.explanation: The Treaty of Versailles was signed in 1919 and officially ended World War I.

questions.question: What was the primary cause of the French Revolution?
questions.explanation: Economic inequality and financial crisis were primary causes of the French Revolution in 1789.

questions.question: Which dynasty ruled China for the longest period?
questions.explanation: The Zhou Dynasty ruled China for about 800 years (1046-256 BCE), the longest in Chinese history.

questions.question: What was the main purpose of the Marshall Plan?
questions.explanation: The Marshall Plan was a U.S. program to rebuild Western Europe after World War II.

questions.question: Which empire was known as the 'Sick Man of Europe'?
questions.explanation: The Ottoman Empire was called the 'Sick Man of Europe' due to its decline in the 19th century.

questions.question: What was the primary goal of the Crusades?
questions.explanation: The primary goal of the Crusades was to reclaim the Holy Land from Muslim control.

questions.question: Which revolution preceded the French Revolution and influenced its ideas?
questions.explanation: The American Revolution (1775-1783) influenced French revolutionary ideas about liberty and democracy.

questions.question: What was the Renaissance?
questions.explanation: The Renaissance was a cultural and intellectual revival in Europe from the 14th to 17th centuries.

questions.question: Which ancient civilization built Machu Picchu?
questions.explanation: Machu Picchu was built by the Inca civilization in the 15th century in Peru.

questions.question: What caused the split between the Roman Catholic and Eastern Orthodox churches?
questions.explanation: The Great Schism of 1054 formally split Christianity into Roman Catholic and Eastern Orthodox churches.
